meanings.definition: The ability of a liquid to spread across or adhere to a solid surface.
meanings.sent1: The wettability of the surface allowed the water to form a thin film.
meanings.sent2: The wettability of the material determined how easily the oil would coat it.
meanings.sent3: The wettability of the table made the spilled juice look like a shiny lake.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project had the wettability of a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The wettability of the paint made it glide smoothly over the canvas.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a surface is capable of being wetted by a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The wettability of the fabric allowed the dye to evenly penetrate.
meanings.sent2: The wettability of the sponge determined how quickly it absorbed the spill.
meanings.sent3: The wettability of the umbrella made it seem like a magnet for raindrops.
meanings.sent4: His charm had the wettability of a non-stick pan, nothing seemed to stick to him.
meanings.sent5: The wettability of the soil affected how water seeped into the ground.
